Name: Noah Omega Braden
Title: Noah Omega Braden file
Description: File documenting the participation of Noah Omega Braden in World War I. Braden enlisted in the Navy on April 5, 1918, and served as a radio electrician first at Newport, Rhode Island. He transferred to Cambridge, Massachusetts, on July 10, 1918, and then to Brooklyn Navy Yard, New York, on December 12, 1918, where he was hospitalized for influenza in March 1919. He was assigned to the U.S.S. Charlot on May 13, 1919, and sailed to Portsmouth, England, Libau (now known as Liepaja in Latvia) and Riga (now located in Latvia) in Russia, Kiel, Germany, Danzig (now known as Gdansk), Poland, Haukipudas in Finland, Stockholm, Sweden, and Cardiff and Pembroke in Wales. He returned to the States on September 20, 1919, and was discharged on October 4, 1919. File includes a survey, address cards, a photo, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; New York Naval Shipyard
Topics: Braden, Noah Omega; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William McKinley Coffey
Title: William McKinley Coffey file
Description: File documenting the participation of William McKinley Coffey in World War I. Coffey was drafted on May 20, 1918, and served with the 3rd Infantry in Del Rio, Texas. He was hospitalized for influenza in February 1919. File includes a survey, signature cards, photos, a letter, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 3rd;
Topics: Coffey, William McKinley; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); photographs; letters (correspondence); reply cards;

Name: Carroll Downey Cox
Location: Great Lakes Naval Training Center (Great Lakes, Ill.)
Title: Carroll Downey Cox file
Description: File documenting the participation of Carroll Downey Cox in World War I. Cox enlisted on April 28, 1917, and served in the Navy Reserves as a Chief Yeoman on the U.S.S. Yantic. He was stationed in Erie, Pennsylvania, transferred to Cleveland, Ohio, in April 1918, and finished his service at the Great Lakes Naval Training Station, Illinois. He was discharged on August 4, 1919. He died on December 13, 1920, from tuberculosis that developed from catching influenza during his service. File includes a survey, address card, photo, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Reserve
Topics: Cox, Carroll Downey; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Clifton Albert Crosby
Title: Clifton Albert Crosby file
Description: File documenting the participation of Clifton Albert Crosby in World War I. Crosby was drafted on May 21, 1918. He first served at Camp Jackson, South Carolina, with the 10th Field Artillery. He joined the Medical Department on July 11, 1918, and joined the 5th Field Artillery on July 12, 1918. On July 25, 1918, he joined the Military Police. Throughtout his service, he was hospitalized multiple times from influenza. Crosby was discharged on February 1, 1919. File includes a survey, letters, a newspaper clipping, and an RSVP card.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Field Artillery; United States. Army. Medical Department;
Topics: Crosby, Clifton Albert; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: questionnaires; cards (information artifacts); letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings; reply cards;

Name: Deane Dillon
Title: Deane Dillon file
Description: File documenting the participation of Deane Dillon in World War I. Dillon enlisted in June 1918 and was first stationed at Camp Wheeler, Georgia. He was transferred to Camp Mills, New York, where he got sick with influenza and moved to a hospital at Camp Merritt, New Jersey. He was discharged in January 1919. File includes newspaper clippings and an RSVP card. Description includes information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Ammunition Train, 106th
Topics: Dillon, Deane; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Linder William Hacker
Title: Linder William Hacker file
Description: File documenting the participation of Linder William Hacker in World War I. Hacker enlisted on July 31, 1918, and served in the Chemical Warfare Service, making gas masks, during which time he was based in Long Island City, New York. File includes survey, two photos of Hacker in uniform, newspaper clippings, and two letters, including a lengthy letter discussing conditions related to the influenza epidemic in New York State.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Chemical Warfare Service
Topics: Hacker, Linder William; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919

Name: Bert Hudgins
Title: Bert Hudgins file
Description: File documenting the participation of Bert Hudgins in World War I. Hudgins enlisted on April 9, 1918, and was stationed at Great Lakes Naval Training Center, Illinois. In August 1918, he transferred to Harvard University to attend the Naval Training School to become a Radio Electrician. On October 28, he was hospitalized for influenza and rheumatism and stayed there until his discharge on December 18, 1918. File includes a survey, photo, letters, a postcard, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Training School (Harvard University); United States. Navy. Radio Electicians
Topics: Hudgins, Bert; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students;

Name: Julius Philip Klemm
Title: Julius Philip Klemm file
Description: File documenting the participationolf Julius Philip Klemm in World War I. Klemm enlisted on June 6, 1917, and first served at Camp Logan, Texas, with the 124th Ordnance Department. He transferred to the Central Machine Gun Officers Training School at Camp Hancock, Georgia, on November 26, 1918. He was hospitalized briefly for influenza. Klemm was discharged in December 1918. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Ordnance Department; Central Machine Gun Officers' Training School (Camp Hancock, Ga.)
Topics: Klemm, Julius Philip; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Russel Leon Lowe
Title: Russel Leon Lowe file
Description: File documenting the participation of Russel Leon Lowe in World War I. Lowe enlisted on July 19, 1917, and first served with the 130th Infantry in Newton, Illinois. He transferred to Camp Logan, Texas, on November 10, 1917, and became a bugler for the 130th Infantry Band. He left for France in April 1918 and was stationed in Albert, France. He served in the Battle of Hamel, Somme Defensive, and the Meuse-Argonne Battle. He was hospitalized for influenza in October 1918 at Glorieux, near Verdun, France. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Oberbillig, Germany, and Betterdorf, Luxembourg. Lowe returned to the States on May 22, 1919, and was discharged on May 31, 1919. File includes a survey and letters.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 130th (1917-1959)
Topics: Lowe, Russel Leon; Bands (Music); Le Hamel, Battle of, Le Hamel, Amiens, France, 1918; Somme, 2nd Battle of the, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Rolf Leo McManus
Title: Rolf Leo McManus file
Description: File includes a letter from the ISNU Alumni Association about the death of Rolf Leo McManus while serving overseas in World War I. McManus was sent to England on October 8, 1918, with the 113th Sanitary Train and became ill with influenza during the trip over. He was immediately hospitalized in Manchester, England, and passed away on October 20, 1918. McManus's remains returned to the states on September 18, 1920. File includes a card with McManus's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty). Description supplemented with information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Sanitary Train, 113th
Topics: McManus, Rolf Leo; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Philip Thomas O'Brien
Title: Philip Thomas O'Brien file
Description: File documenting the participation of Philip Thomas O'Brien in World War I. O'Brien enlisted on December 8, 1917, and served with the 210th Aero Squadron at the Chanute Field in Illinois. He was sent overseas on February 26, 1918, and was stationed at Doncaster in Yorkshire, England. He was hospitalized for influenza in Sheffield, England, and later at the Mossley Hill Camp in Liverpool, England, from August 27, 1918, to September 20, 1918. O'Brien was discharged on December 24, 1918. File includes a survey, postcard, newspaper clippings, and an RSVP card. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 210th
Topics: O'Brien, Philip Thomas; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919

Name: Lawrence Truman Oxley
Title: Lawrence Truman Oxley file
Description: File documenting the participation of Lawrence Truman Oxley in World War I. Oxley enlisted on June 28, 1918, and trained at Camp Taylor, Kentucky, with the 159th Depot Brigade. He was transferred to Camp Beauregard, Louisiana, on July 22, 1918, and joined the 114th Military Police battalion. Oxley was sent overseas on August 21, 1918. He was stationed in Chaumont, France, with the 2nd General Headquarters Military Police in December 1918. From February 22, 1919, to March 15, 1919, he was hospitalized for influenza in Chaumont at Base Hospital #90. In April 1919, he began teaching at the American Expeditionary Forces University in Beaune, France. Oxley returned to the States on June 10, 1919, and was discharged on July 7, 1919. File includes a survey, address cards, letters, and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Depot Brigade, 159th; United States. Army. Military Police Battalion, 114; American Expeditionary Forces University (Beaune, France)
Topics: Oxley, Lawrence Truman; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Roy Pyatt
Title: Roy Pyatt file
Description: File documenting the participation of Roy Pyatt in World War I. Pyatt enlisted on June 24, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Taylor, Kentucky with the depot brigade. He transferred to Camp Funston, Kansas, to Heavy Artillery. He was hospitalized for influenza on October 1918. File includes a survey.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Heavy Artillery
Topics: Pyatt, Roy; World War, 1914-1918; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; University High School (Normal, Ill.)--Students;

Name: William Eston Quick
Title: William Eston Quick file
Description: File documenting the participation of William Eston Quick in World War I. Quick enlisted on May 27, 1918, and was first stationed at Camp Gordon, Georgia, with the 6th Replacement Regiment. He was promoted to sergeant of the 1st Replacement on August 1, 1918, and began instructing soldiers in gas and bayonet defense. He was hospitalized in October 1918 for influenza. Quick was discharged on January 2, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Replacement Regiment, 6th; United States. Army. Replacement Regiment, 1st
Topics: Quick, William Eston; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Frederick Stanilas Rabe
Title: Frederick Stanilas Rabe file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frederick Stanilas Rabe in World War I. Rabe enlisted on May 25, 1918, and was stationed at Camp Shelby, Mississippi, with the 149th Infantry Machine Gun Co. He was sent overseas on October 2, 1918, and was hospitalized in Portsmouth, England, with influenza upon arrival. After the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Winchester, England, and later in St. Aignan, France. He was hospitalized again on February 20, 1919. Rabe returned to the States on March 25, 1919, and was discharged April 9, 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings, including one about John O. Morrissey signing a petition protesting the slow pace of soldiers being discharged and sent home.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Infantry Regiment, 149th
Topics: Rabe, Frederick Stanilas; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Percy Jackson Rutherford
Title: Percy Jackson Rutherford file
Description: File documenting the participation of Percy Jackson Rutherford in World War I. Rutherford enlisted on December 15, 1917, in the Marines. He trained at Parris Island, South Carolina, with the 5th Marines before he was sent overseas. He was hospitalized June 14, 1918, at Dijon, France, and on November 8, 1918, in Mesves-sur-Loire, France, for influenza. Rutherford returned to the States on August 3, 1919. File includes a survey and photo. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Marine Corps; United States. Marine Corps. Marine Regiment, 5th
Topics: Rutherford, Percy Jackson; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Ellis Deloss Stubblefield
Title: Ellis Deloss Stubblefield file
Description: File documenting the participation of Ellis Deloss Stubblefield in World War I. Stubblefield enlisted on July 20, 1917, and was first stationed at Camp Custer, Michigan with the Quartermaster Corps. He joined the 344th Motor Truck Company on October 15, 1917, and later joined the Engineer Corps on the 457th Motor Truck Company on January 18, 1918, at Fort Myer, Virginia. He was sent overseas on May 10, 1918, and was stationed at Bordeaux, France, with the 695th Motor Transport Company. In November 1918, he was hospitalized for influenza. Stubblefield left for the States on July 8, 1919, and was discharged in July 1919. File includes surveys and newspaper clippings. Description supplemented by information from Fold3.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. War Dept. Quartermaster Corps; United States. Army. Motor Truck Company, 344th; United States. Army. Corps of Engineers; United States. Army. Motor Truck Company, 457th; United States. Army. Motor Truck Company, 695th

Name: Edmund White Sutherland
Title: Edmund White Sutherland file
Description: File documenting the participation of Edmund White Sutherland in World War I. Sutherland entered the service on September 5, 1918, at Camp Grant, Illinois. He died on October 7, 1918, from pneumonia caused by influenza. File includes a photo, a letter from his wife, newspaper clippings, and a card with Sutherland's name with a gold star (used to denote the files of individuals who died in the line of duty).
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army
Topics: Sutherland, Edmund White; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
Genre/format: cards (information artifacts); photographs; letters (correspondence); newspaper clippings;

Name: Raymond Ford Ward
Title: Raymond Ford Ward file
Description: File documenting the participation of Raymond Ford Ward in World War I. Ward enlisted on May 19, 1918, and was stationed at Caswell, North Carolina, with the 5th Coast Artillery Corps. He was sent overseas on September 23, 1918. After the armistice was signed, he was transferred to the 54th Coast Artillery Corps and stationed in Angers, France. He was hospitalized at British Hospital no. 67 for influenza on October 14, 1918. On October 29, 1918, he was hospitalized in Cherbourg, France, for spinal meningitis. Ward returned to the States on March 6, 1919. File includes a survey and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 5th; United States. Army. Coast Artillery Regiment, 54th
Topics: Ward, Raymond Ford; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Donald Dooley Whitcomb
Title: Donald Dooley Whitcomb file
Description: File documenting the participation of Donald Dooley Whitcomb in World War I. Whitcomb enlisted on May 23, 1917, and was first stationed in El Paso, Texas, with the 2nd Engineers. He was sent overseas on September 10, 1917, and was stationed in Sommedieue, France. He participated in the battles at the Toulon sector, the Aisne-Marne Offensive, in the Marbache sector, St. Mihiel, Chateau-Thierry, in the Champagne sector, and the Meuse-Argonne Offensive. He was hospitalized for influenza on October 29, 1918, in Vichy, France. Whitcomb returned to the States on August 12, 1919, and was discharged on August 15, 1919. File includes a survey, postcard, letters, newspaper clippings, and Whitcomb's marriage announcement.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Engineer Regiment, 2nd
Topics: Whitcomb, Walter Dooley; Saint-Mihiel, Battle of, Saint-Mihiel, France, 1918; Ch├óteau-Thierry, Battle of, Ch├óteau-Thierry, France, 1918; Argonne, Battle of the, France, 1918; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: William George Wiegand
Title: William George Wiegand file
Description: File documenting the participation of William George Wiegand in World War I. Wiegand enlisted on June 14, 1918, and was first stationed at Rahe's Automated Tractor School in Kansas City, Missouri. He joined the Motor Transport Corps 302nd Water Tank Train on August 17, 1918, at Camp Holabird, Maryland. He was hospitalized for influenza from September 25 to October 3, 1918, at Camp Upton, New York. He was sent overseas on November 3, 1918, and, after the armistice was signed, he was stationed in Pannes, France. He was hospitalized March 6 to March 13, 1919, in Dijon, France due to illness. He returned to the States on April 27, 1919, and received surgical treatment at Camp Grant, Illinois, on May 5, 1919. Wiegand was discharged on May 28, 1919. File includes a survey and photo.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Motor Transport Corps
Topics: Wiegand, William George; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Julius E. Wiemers
Title: Julius E. Wiemers file
Description: File documenting the participation of Julius E. Wiemers in World War I. Wiemers enlisted on July 24, 1918, and served at Scott Field, Illinois, with the 221st Aero Squadron. He was hospitalized from November 13 to November 27, 1919, for influenza. Wiemers was discharged on April 17, 1919. File includes a survey, photos, and a letter.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Army; United States. Army. Air Service; United States. Army. Air Service. Aero Squadron, 221st
Topics: Wiemers, Julius E.; Influenza Epidemic, 1918-1919; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students

Name: Frank Charles Zimmerman
Title: Frank Charles Zimmerman file
Description: File documenting the participation of Frank Charles Zimmerman in World War I. Zimmerman enlisted on July 29, 1918, and was stationed at Charleston, South Carolina with the Naval Aviaton Corps. He transferred to the Hampton Roads Naval Base in Virginia on September 8, 1918. He was hospitalized for influenza and pneumonia from September 1918 until November 1918. Zimmerman was discharged on January 29, 1919. File includes a survey, postcard, letters, and newspaper clippings.
Related organization/service branch: United States. Navy; United States. Naval Aviation Corps
Topics: Zimmerman, Frank Charles; World War, 1914-1918; Illinois State Normal University--Students
